intro: Gerardia stricta, commonly known as the rigid gerardia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features a tall, slender stem with alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are finely divided. Its small, white or greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Gerardia stricta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
